thread.title_full: Scott City man arrested after police recover stolen mini excavator

author: Josh Seabaugh
title: Scott City man arrested after police recover stolen mini excavator
text: SCOTT CITY, Mo. (KFVS) - A Scott City man has been arrested after a stolen mini excavator was recovered on Tuesday. On Tuesday, June 11, officers with the Scott City Police Department recovered a stolen Caterpillar mini excavator from a local address. According to the police department, the implement was reported stolen from Jefferson County, Missouri on Sunday, June 9. Officers received information that the implement was parked at a local address that belonged to Christopher L. Klughart of Scott City. Officers located the CAT at the address that was provided and recovered it. On Tuesday evening, officers with the assistance of the Scott County Sheriff’s Office executed a search warrant at an additional local address of Klughart, as a result of a narcotics investigation. As a result of the search, officers recovered documents related to the stolen CAT and also recovered an approximate weight value of over 100 grams of narcotics in liquated form. Drug paraphernalia was also discovered during the search. Klughart was formally charged with the following: - Deliver controlled substance except 35 grams or less of Marijuana or synthetic cannabinoid - Tampering with physical evidence in felony prosecution - Unlawful possession of drug paraphernalia - Stealing Klughart is currently in custody at the Scott County Sheriff’s Office on no bond allowed warrant for the narcotics. He was given a $15,000.00 cash only bond for the charge of felony stealing. Copyright 2024 KFVS. All rights reserved.
